content: Can you see the PrivacyPay repo? If so, list the primary sections of the directory structure

Not yet—I don’t have the PrivacyPay repo tree loaded in this session, so I can’t list its directories until I read it.

## TL;DR
Set the active repo to PrivacyPay (or share a tree output), and I’ll enumerate the top-level sections immediately.

## Quick options
- If PrivacyPay is the current target: tell me to “list it” and I’ll fetch the directory structure.
- If you’re at a terminal: run one of the commands below and paste the output.

## Commands to capture the structure
- If you have the tree utility:
  ```
  tree -L 2 -a -I '.git|node_modules|dist|build'
  ```
- Without tree:
  ```
  find . -maxdepth 2 -type d ! -path '*/.git/*' ! -name '.git' | sort
  ```

## What I expect (tentative)
From earlier README fragments, PrivacyPay appears to include modules like:
- standard
- p2p
- allocator
- fiat_routing

I’ll confirm the full, accurate top-level layout as soon as I can read the repo tree.

webResultsPreview.title: Github repository directory structure - Stack Overflow
webResultsPreview.snippet: ... If you visit your repo on GitHub ... In general any git repo, and as a result a GitHub remote repo, they have the exact same structure as your local project....

webResultsPreview.title: Creating a new repository - GitHub Docs
webResultsPreview.snippet: For more information, see Creating a repository from a template. Optionally, if you chose to use a template, to include the directory structure and files from all branches in the template, and not just the default branch, select Include all branches.

webResultsPreview.title: How do I get the directory tree structure from a Github repository link - Stack Overflow
webResultsPreview.snippet: Given a github repo link, I want to generate the directory tree structure and display it in a web application UI. Other than scraping the link, is there any other method which I can use through Github API perhaps? ... If you can clone the repository to your local machine.

webResultsPreview.title: Git Repository Structure - GreenGeeks
webResultsPreview.snippet: Once all the commands and functions, then you will better understand the Git repository structure. Below, you will see how the repository structure is set up. Therefore, this should give you a better idea of how it functions and what it looks like. You will see that a .git directory has a similar structure to the layout below.

webResultsPreview.title: GitHub Private Repository: Managing Private Repositories
webResultsPreview.snippet: The preferred option is through the command line (CLI) using the following steps: Create a GitHub Organization Or a Private Repository Make a “bare” clone of the repository which needs to be imported. This creates a full copy of the data, but without a working directory, which cannot be used for editing files.
